metadata.title: CVE-2021-23972 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
One phishing tactic on the web is to provide a link with HTTP Auth. Forexample 'https://www.phishingtarget.com@evil.com'. To mitigate this type ofattack, Firefox will display a warning dialog; however, this warning dialogwould not have been displayed if evil.com used a redirect that was cachedby the browser. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 86.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23972` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 86.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 86.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 86.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '86.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
